comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Alexander Konta was the founder of the Hungarian-American Loyalty League, formed in January 1918. It was reported that he was an opponent of Wilson's policy (see the New-York tribune, September 26, 1918, Image 1, first column) see also www.hungarianhistory.com/lib/wils/wils03.htm The New York Times, September 26, 1918
